wiki.content: "(Looking for) The Heart of Saturday Night" is a track on Tom Waits' second studio album entitled "The Heart of Saturday Night" released in 1974. The song has been covered by a number of other artists, including Jonathan Richman, Jerry Jeff Walker, Dion, Madeleine Peyroux, Diana Krall, Gwyneth Herbert, and Shawn Colvin. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "(Looking for) The Heart of Saturday Night" is a track on Tom Waits' second studio album entitled "The Heart of Saturday Night" released in 1974. The song has been covered by a number of other artists, including Jonathan Richman, Jerry Jeff Walker, Dion, Madeleine Peyroux, Diana Krall, Gwyneth Herbert, and Shawn Colvin.

track.name: (Looking for) The Heart of Saturday Night
comments: I hate when LastFM ruins songs. If it says Tom Waits, I want to hear some fucking Tom Waits, not this awful cover!
Slow down love...did she need the toilet or something?
this is not a cover, this is Tom, some studio outtake
no cheesy covers. NO CHEESY COVERS. AARGH
Perfect song for a Saturday night!
With your arm around your sweet one in your Oldsmobile..<3
You're dreaming of them saturdays that came before... it's found ya stumblin', stumblin' onto the heart of saturday night...
